CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 18, 1939, pg. 7, reads: "Pittsburgh Debs About Town Have Kiddies' Party - Time turned backward in its wild flight Saturday evening and Pittsburgh's beautiful Debs About Town turned kiddies ... short skirts, hair ribbons, dollies, et. al. Here they are at the party in play room at Marian [Marion] Harris' ... oh, yes, the boys were there, but the male of the species do not shed the years so gracefully.  Sitting, oh so high ... Joyce Roberts, Marian Harris, Ethel Mae Cole.  Standing left to right, Helen Phillips, Lydia Taylor, Dorothy Garrison, Olive McNeal, Eloise Robinson, Anna Powell.  Front row, Barbara Jones, Thelma Spangler, Helen Douglass, Alice Lindsay, president; Roslyn Lindsay, Louise Barnett, Romaine Denning.  Romaine won first prize for the girls; Frank Bolden for the boys."
TitMainTitle: Members of Debs About Town, seated in rear from left: Marion Harris, Ethel Mae Cole; in front: Barbara Jones, Thelma Spangler, Helen Douglass, Alice or Alyce Lindsay, Roslyn Lindsay, Louise Barnett, and Romaine Denning, posed in girl's dresses with dolls and lollipops, and men including Earl Barnett in floppy tie near right, in home or boxing gym of William "Woogie" Harris, Frankstown Road, Penn Hills
